intro: Sebaea ochroleuca, commonly known as the white sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and clustered foliage. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
